module.name: HTTPDefs
module.short: Basic HTTP protocol declarations and classes

descr.p: The HTTPDefs unit provides essential types, constants, and classes for HTTP protocol handling. It contains basic HTTP header field definitions, request and response classes, cookie management, file upload support, and MIME content handling for web applications.

element.short: HTTP protocol constants and utility functions

element.name: HTTPMonths
element.short: Array of month abbreviations for HTTP dates

descr.p: HTTPMonths is an array containing 3-letter abbreviations for months (Jan, Feb, Mar, etc.) used in HTTP date formatting.

element.name: HTTPDays
element.short: Array of day abbreviations for HTTP dates

descr.p: HTTPDays is an array containing 3-letter abbreviations for days of the week (Sun, Mon, Tue, etc.) used in HTTP date formatting.
RTLString is an alias for AnsiString, providing a string type that is compatible with the runtime library.
THTTPVariableType defines the different types of HTTP-related variables that can be handled by the web server. These include request information, headers, and CGI environment variables.
THTTPVariableTypes is a set type based on THTTPVariableType enumeration. It allows specification of multiple HTTP variable types simultaneously.
THTTPVariables is an array type that maps HTTP variable types to their corresponding values. This provides indexed access to HTTP request and environment variables.

element.name: THttpFields
element.short: Array of HTTP header field names

descr.p: THttpFields is an array type containing HTTP header field names. This array maps field indexes to their corresponding header field name strings.

element.name: THttpIndexes
element.short: Array of HTTP header field indexes

descr.p: THttpIndexes is an array type containing HTTP header field index mappings. This array provides reverse lookup from header field names to their indexes.

element.name: HeaderBasedVariables
element.short: Set of HTTP variables derived from header fields

descr.p: HeaderBasedVariables contains a set of HTTP variable types that are derived from HTTP headers. This constant identifies which variables correspond to standard HTTP header fields.

element.name: HTTPFieldNames
element.short: Array of standard HTTP header field names

descr.p: HTTPFieldNames is an array containing the names of standard HTTP header fields. This array provides mapping from field indexes to their string representations.

element.name: HTTPFieldIndexes
element.short: Array of HTTP header field index mappings

descr.p: HTTPFieldIndexes is an array that maps HTTP variable types to their corresponding field indexes. This provides efficient lookup of header field positions by variable type.
TContentStreamingState defines the different states during streaming content processing. Used when processing multipart content or other streamed data.

TRequest represents an HTTP request received by a web server. It extends and provides access to request data including headers, query parameters, form data, uploaded files, and other request information.
TSameSite defines the possible values for the SameSite cookie attribute, which controls when cookies are sent with cross-site requests.

dl.dd: Cookie sent with all cross-site requests
Cookie only sent with same-site requests
Cookie sent with top-level navigation cross-site requests

descr.p: TCookie represents an HTTP cookie with all its attributes. It provides properties for name, value, domain, path, expiration, security settings, and other cookie attributes.
Create initializes a new TCookie instance as part of the specified collection.

element.name: TCookie.Create.ACollection
element.short: Collection to which the cookie belongs

element.name: TCookie.Assign
element.short: Assigns values from another persistent object

descr.p: Assign copies all cookie properties from the source TCookie object to this instance.

element.name: TCookie.Assign.Source
element.short: Source object to copy cookie data from

descr.p: Expire sets the cookie's expiration date to a past date, causing the client to delete the cookie.
Name specifies the name of the cookie. This is the identifier used to reference the cookie.
Value contains the data stored in the cookie. This is the information that will be sent back by the client.
Domain specifies which domain the cookie applies to. If empty, the cookie applies only to the current domain.
Path specifies the URL path that must exist in the requested URL for the browser to send the cookie. If not specified, defaults to the path of the request URL that generated the cookie.

element.name: TCookie.Expires
element.short: Expiration date and time of the cookie

descr.p: Expires specifies when the cookie should expire. After this date and time, the browser will delete the cookie automatically.

element.name: TCookie.MaxAge
element.short: Maximum age of the cookie in seconds

descr.p: MaxAge specifies the cookie lifetime in seconds from the time it was created. This takes precedence over the Expires attribute if both are present.
Secure determines whether the cookie should only be sent over secure (HTTPS) connections. When True, the cookie will not be sent over unencrypted HTTP connections.
HttpOnly when True prevents client-side scripts from accessing the cookie, reducing the risk of cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.
SameSite controls whether cookies are sent with cross-site requests. This attribute helps prevent cross-site request forgery attacks.
Partitioned indicates that the cookie should be partitioned storage. This provides additional privacy protection by isolating cookies in different storage partitions.
AsString returns the complete cookie as a string formatted according to HTTP cookie specifications. This includes the name, value, and all attributes formatted for transmission in HTTP headers.
TCookies is a collection class that manages multiple TCookie objects. It provides methods to add, find, and access cookies by name or index.

element.name: TCookies.Add
element.short: Adds a new cookie to the collection

descr.p: Add creates and adds a new TCookie instance to the collection, returning a reference to it.

element.name: TCookies.AddFromString
element.short: Adds a cookie from a string representation

descr.p: AddFromString parses a cookie string and creates a new TCookie instance from it. The string should be in the format used in HTTP Set-Cookie headers.

element.name: TCookies.AddFromString.S
element.short: String representation of the cookie to add

descr.p: CookieByName searches for and returns a cookie with the specified name. If no cookie is found, it returns nil.

element.name: TCookies.CookieByName.Result
element.short: Cookie with the specified name or nil if not found

element.name: TCookies.CookieByName.AName
element.short: Name of the cookie to find

descr.p: FindCookie searches for a cookie with the specified name and returns it. Returns nil if no cookie with the given name is found.

element.name: TCookies.FindCookie.Result
element.short: Cookie with the specified name or nil if not found

element.name: TCookies.FindCookie.AName
element.short: Name of the cookie to find

element.name: TCookies.IndexOfCookie
element.short: Returns the index of a cookie by name

descr.p: IndexOfCookie returns the zero-based index of the cookie with the specified name. Returns -1 if no cookie with the given name is found.

element.name: TCookies.IndexOfCookie.Result
element.short: Index of the cookie or -1 if not found

element.name: TCookies.IndexOfCookie.AName
element.short: Name of the cookie to find

descr.p: Items provides indexed access to cookies in the collection. This is the default array property for the TCookies class.

element.name: TCookies.Items.Index
element.short: Index of the cookie to retrieve

element.name: TUploadedFile
element.short: Represents an uploaded file in an HTTP request

descr.p: TUploadedFile encapsulates information about a file uploaded through an HTML form using multipart/form-data encoding. It provides access to the file content, metadata, and properties such as filename, size, and content type.
Destroy cleans up resources used by the uploaded file instance. This includes closing any associated streams and removing temporary files.

element.name: TUploadedFile.FieldName
element.short: Form field name of the uploaded file

descr.p: FieldName contains the name of the HTML form field that was used to upload the file. This corresponds to the 'name' attribute of the input element in the form.

element.name: TUploadedFile.FileName
element.short: Original filename of the uploaded file

descr.p: FileName contains the original filename as specified by the client. This is the name of the file on the client's system before it was uploaded.

element.name: TUploadedFile.Stream
element.short: Stream containing the uploaded file data

descr.p: Stream provides access to the uploaded file content. The stream can be read to retrieve the file data or written to a local file.

element.name: TUploadedFile.Size
element.short: Size of the uploaded file in bytes

descr.p: Size indicates the total size of the uploaded file content in bytes. This represents the actual size of the data that was uploaded.

element.name: TUploadedFile.ContentType
element.short: MIME content type of the uploaded file

descr.p: ContentType contains the MIME type of the uploaded file as specified by the client. This indicates the type of content in the file (e.g., 'image/jpeg', 'text/plain').

element.name: TUploadedFile.Disposition
element.short: Content disposition header of the uploaded file

descr.p: Disposition contains the Content-Disposition header value from the multipart data. This typically includes information about how the content should be displayed or handled.

element.name: TUploadedFile.LocalFileName
element.short: Local temporary filename where file is stored

descr.p: LocalFileName contains the path to the temporary file where the uploaded content is stored on the server. This file is created during the upload process and should be moved or copied to a permanent location if needed.
Description contains additional descriptive information about the uploaded file. This may include user-provided descriptions or other metadata associated with the upload.

element.name: TUploadedFileClass
element.short: Class type for uploaded file instances

descr.p: TUploadedFileClass is a class reference type that allows creating instances of TUploadedFile or its descendants. This enables customization of uploaded file handling by using derived classes.
TUploadedFiles manages a collection of TUploadedFile instances. It provides methods to access, search, and manage uploaded files from HTTP requests.

element.name: TUploadedFiles.First
element.short: Returns the first uploaded file in the collection

descr.p: First returns the first TUploadedFile in the collection. Returns nil if the collection is empty.

element.name: TUploadedFiles.First.Result
element.short: First uploaded file or nil if collection is empty

element.name: TUploadedFiles.Last
element.short: Returns the last uploaded file in the collection

descr.p: Last returns the last TUploadedFile in the collection. Returns nil if the collection is empty.

element.name: TUploadedFiles.Last.Result
element.short: Last uploaded file or nil if collection is empty

element.name: TUploadedFiles.IndexOfFile
element.short: Returns the index of an uploaded file by field name

descr.p: IndexOfFile searches for an uploaded file with the specified field name and returns its index. Returns -1 if no file with the given field name is found.

element.name: TUploadedFiles.IndexOfFile.Result
element.short: Index of the file or -1 if not found

element.name: TUploadedFiles.IndexOfFile.AName
element.short: Field name of the uploaded file to find

element.name: TUploadedFiles.FileByName
element.short: Returns an uploaded file by field name

descr.p: FileByName searches for and returns an uploaded file with the specified field name. Returns nil if no file with the given field name is found.

element.name: TUploadedFiles.FileByName.Result
element.short: Uploaded file with the specified field name or nil if not found

element.name: TUploadedFiles.FileByName.AName
element.short: Field name of the uploaded file to find

element.name: TUploadedFiles.FindFile
element.short: Finds an uploaded file by field name

descr.p: FindFile locates and returns an uploaded file with the specified field name. This method is an alias for FileByName.

element.name: TUploadedFiles.FindFile.Result
element.short: Uploaded file with the specified field name or nil if not found

element.name: TUploadedFiles.FindFile.AName
element.short: Field name of the uploaded file to find

element.name: TUploadedFiles.Files
element.short: Uploaded file at the specified index

descr.p: Files provides indexed access to uploaded files in the collection. This is the default array property for the TUploadedFiles class.

element.name: TUploadedFiles.Files.Index
element.short: Index of the uploaded file to retrieve

element.name: TUploadedFilesClass
element.short: Class type for uploaded files collection

descr.p: TUploadedFilesClass is a class reference type for creating instances of TUploadedFiles or its descendants. This enables customization of uploaded files collection handling.
TMimeItem represents a single part within a MIME multipart message. It encapsulates the content, headers, and metadata for one item in a multipart HTTP request.
ProcessStreaming processes MIME data incrementally as it arrives in a stream. This allows handling of large uploads without loading the entire content into memory.

element.name: TMimeItem.Process
element.short: Processes MIME data from a stream

descr.p: Process reads and parses MIME data from the provided stream. This method processes the entire MIME item content in one operation.

element.name: TMimeItem.Process.Stream
element.short: Stream containing MIME data to process

descr.p: RawData contains the original unprocessed content of the MIME item. This includes the raw bytes as received in the multipart message.
Data contains the processed content of the MIME item. This is the decoded data after applying any content transfer encoding.

element.name: TMimeItem.Name
element.short: Name attribute of the MIME item

descr.p: Name contains the name attribute from the Content-Disposition header. This typically corresponds to the form field name for form uploads.

element.name: TMimeItem.Disposition
element.short: Content disposition of the MIME item

descr.p: Disposition contains the complete Content-Disposition header value. This specifies how the content should be handled (e.g., 'form-data', 'attachment').

element.name: TMimeItem.FileName
element.short: Filename attribute of the MIME item

descr.p: FileName contains the filename attribute from the Content-Disposition header. This represents the original filename of an uploaded file.

element.name: TMimeItem.ContentType
element.short: Content type of the MIME item

descr.p: ContentType contains the MIME type of the item content. This indicates the format and nature of the data (e.g., 'text/plain', 'image/jpeg').
Description contains the Content-Description header value if present. This provides additional descriptive information about the MIME item content.

element.name: TMimeItem.IsFile
element.short: Indicates whether the MIME item is a file

descr.p: IsFile returns True if the MIME item represents a file upload. This is determined by the presence of a filename attribute in the Content-Disposition header.

element.name: TMimeItem.DataSize
element.short: Size of the MIME item data in bytes

descr.p: DataSize indicates the total size of the MIME item data in bytes. This represents the actual size of the content after any decoding.

element.name: TMimeItemClass
element.short: Class type for MIME item instances

descr.p: TMimeItemClass is a class reference type for creating instances of TMimeItem or its descendants. This enables customization of MIME item processing.
TMimeItems manages a collection of TMimeItem instances representing the parts of a multipart MIME message. It provides access to the individual items and handles multipart parsing.

element.name: TMimeItems.First
element.short: Returns the first MIME item in the collection

descr.p: First returns the first TMimeItem in the collection. Returns nil if the collection is empty.

element.name: TMimeItems.First.Result
element.short: First MIME item or nil if collection is empty

element.name: TMimeItems.Last
element.short: Returns the last MIME item in the collection

descr.p: Last returns the last TMimeItem in the collection. Returns nil if the collection is empty.

element.name: TMimeItems.Last.Result
element.short: Last MIME item or nil if collection is empty

element.name: TMimeItems.Parts
element.short: MIME item at the specified index

descr.p: Parts provides indexed access to TMimeItem instances in the collection. This is the default array property for the TMimeItems class.

element.name: TMimeItems.Parts.AIndex
element.short: Index of the MIME item to retrieve

descr.p: Preamble contains any text that appears before the first multipart boundary. This text is typically ignored by MIME-aware applications but may contain explanatory information.
Boundary contains the boundary string used to separate parts in the multipart message. This value is specified in the Content-Type header of the multipart message.

element.name: TMimeItems.Files
element.short: Collection of uploaded files from MIME items

descr.p: Files provides access to a collection of uploaded files extracted from the MIME items. This collection contains only those MIME items that represent file uploads.

element.name: TMimeItemsClass
element.short: Class type for MIME items collection

descr.p: TMimeItemsClass is a class reference type for creating instances of TMimeItems or its descendants. This enables customization of MIME items collection handling.

element.name: TStreamingMimeItems
element.short: Collection for streaming MIME multipart items

descr.p: TStreamingMimeItems extends TMimeItems to support streaming processing of large multipart messages. This allows handling of very large uploads without loading the entire content into memory at once.

element.name: THTTPHeader
element.short: Base class for HTTP header management

descr.p: THTTPHeader provides common functionality for handling HTTP headers, variables, and content. It serves as the base class for both TRequest and TResponse classes.
Create initializes a new HTTP header instance. This sets up the internal structures for managing HTTP header fields and variables.
Destroy cleans up resources used by the HTTP header instance. This includes freeing internal collections and associated objects.

element.name: THTTPHeader.HeaderIsSet
element.short: Checks if a specific header field is set

descr.p: HeaderIsSet determines whether a specific HTTP header field has been set. Returns True if the header field contains a value, False otherwise.

element.name: THTTPHeader.HeaderIsSet.Result
element.short: True if the header field is set, False otherwise

element.name: THTTPHeader.GetHeader
element.short: Gets the value of a specific header field

descr.p: GetHeader retrieves the value of a specific HTTP header field. Returns an empty string if the header field is not set.

element.name: THTTPHeader.GetHeader.Result
element.short: Value of the header field or empty string if not set

element.name: THTTPHeader.SetHeader
element.short: Sets the value of a specific header field

descr.p: SetHeader assigns a value to a specific HTTP header field. This method updates the header field with the provided value.

element.name: THTTPHeader.SetHeader.AValue
element.short: Value to set for the header field

element.name: THTTPHeader.SetFieldByName
element.short: Sets a header field value by field name

descr.p: SetFieldByName sets a header field value using the field name as a string. This provides a flexible way to set header fields by name rather than by enumerated type.

element.name: THTTPHeader.SetFieldByName.AName
element.short: Name of the header field to set

element.name: THTTPHeader.SetFieldByName.AValue
element.short: Value to set for the header field

element.name: THTTPHeader.GetFieldByName
element.short: Gets a header field value by field name

descr.p: GetFieldByName retrieves a header field value using the field name as a string. Returns an empty string if the field is not found.

element.name: THTTPHeader.GetFieldByName.Result
element.short: Value of the header field or empty string if not found

element.name: THTTPHeader.GetFieldByName.AName
element.short: Name of the header field to retrieve

element.name: THTTPHeader.GetVariableHeaderName
element.short: Gets the header field name for an HTTP variable type

descr.p: GetVariableHeaderName returns the HTTP header field name corresponding to a given HTTP variable type. This provides the mapping from enumerated types to header field strings.

element.name: THTTPHeader.GetVariableHeaderName.Result
element.short: Header field name corresponding to the variable type

element.name: THTTPHeader.GetVariableHeaderName.AVariable
element.short: HTTP variable type to get the header name for

element.name: THTTPHeader.GetVariableHeaderType
element.short: Gets the HTTP variable type for a header field name

descr.p: GetVariableHeaderType returns the HTTP variable type corresponding to a given header field name. This provides reverse mapping from header field strings to enumerated types.

element.name: THTTPHeader.GetVariableHeaderType.Result
element.short: HTTP variable type corresponding to the header field name

element.name: THTTPHeader.GetVariableHeaderType.aName
element.short: Header field name to get the variable type for

element.name: THTTPHeader.ParseContentType
element.short: Parses a content type header value

descr.p: ParseContentType analyzes a Content-Type header value and extracts the main type and parameters. This utility method helps process content type information from HTTP headers.

element.name: THTTPHeader.ParseContentType.Parameters
element.short: String list to receive content type parameters

element.name: THTTPHeader.GetCustomHeader
element.short: Gets a custom header field value by name

descr.p: GetCustomHeader retrieves the value of a custom (non-standard) HTTP header field. Custom headers are typically application-specific extensions to the standard HTTP headers.

element.name: THTTPHeader.GetCustomHeader.Result
element.short: Value of the custom header field

element.name: THTTPHeader.GetCustomHeader.Name
element.short: Name of the custom header field

element.name: THTTPHeader.SetCustomHeader
element.short: Sets a custom header field value by name

descr.p: SetCustomHeader assigns a value to a custom (non-standard) HTTP header field. This allows setting application-specific header extensions beyond standard HTTP headers.

element.name: THTTPHeader.SetCustomHeader.Name
element.short: Name of the custom header field

element.name: THTTPHeader.SetCustomHeader.Value
element.short: Value to set for the custom header field

element.name: THTTPHeader.LoadFromStream
element.short: Loads HTTP headers from a stream

descr.p: LoadFromStream parses HTTP header data from a stream and populates the header fields. This method can optionally include parsing of the command line (request/status line).

element.name: THTTPHeader.LoadFromStream.Result
element.short: True if headers were loaded successfully

element.name: THTTPHeader.LoadFromStream.IncludeCommand
element.short: Whether to include the command line in parsing

element.name: THTTPHeader.LoadFromStrings
element.short: Loads HTTP headers from a string list

descr.p: LoadFromStrings parses HTTP header data from a string list and populates the header fields. Each string in the list represents a header line in standard HTTP format.

element.name: THTTPHeader.LoadFromStrings.Result
element.short: True if headers were loaded successfully

element.name: THTTPHeader.LoadFromStrings.Strings
element.short: String list containing HTTP header lines

element.name: THTTPHeader.LoadFromStrings.IncludeCommand
element.short: Whether to include the command line in parsing

descr.p: FieldCount returns the total number of header fields that have been set. This includes both standard and custom header fields.

element.name: THTTPHeader.Fields
element.short: Header field name and value at the specified index

descr.p: Fields provides indexed access to header field name-value pairs. Returns the complete field in the format 'Name: Value'.

element.name: THTTPHeader.Fields.AIndex
element.short: Index of the header field to retrieve

element.name: THTTPHeader.FieldNames
element.short: Name of the header field at the specified index

descr.p: FieldNames provides indexed access to header field names only. This returns just the name portion without the value.

element.name: THTTPHeader.FieldNames.AIndex
element.short: Index of the header field name to retrieve

element.name: THTTPHeader.FieldValues
element.short: Value of the header field at the specified index

descr.p: FieldValues provides indexed access to header field values only. This returns just the value portion without the field name.

element.name: THTTPHeader.FieldValues.AIndex
element.short: Index of the header field value to retrieve

descr.p: Accept contains the Accept header field value, which specifies the media types that are acceptable for the response. This indicates what content types the client can process.
AcceptCharset contains the Accept-Charset header field value, which specifies the character encodings that are acceptable for the response.

AcceptEncoding contains the Accept-Encoding header field value, which specifies the content encodings that are acceptable for the response. This typically includes compression methods like gzip or deflate.
AcceptLanguage contains the Accept-Language header field value, which specifies the natural languages that are preferred for the response.
Authorization contains the Authorization header field value, which provides authentication credentials for the request. This typically includes the authentication scheme and credentials.
Connection contains the Connection header field value, which specifies connection options for the current connection. Common values include 'keep-alive' and 'close'.
ContentEncoding contains the Content-Encoding header field value, which specifies any encoding applied to the entity body. This typically indicates compression methods like gzip or deflate.
ContentLanguage contains the Content-Language header field value, which specifies the natural language of the content. This indicates what language the content is written in.
ContentLength contains the Content-Length header field value, which indicates the size of the entity body in bytes. This specifies the exact length of the message body.

ContentType contains the Content-Type header field value, which specifies the media type of the entity body. This indicates the format and nature of the content (e.g., 'text/html', 'application/json').
Date contains the Date header field value, which represents the date and time when the message was sent. This is formatted according to RFC 7231 date format.
Expires contains the Expires header field value, which specifies when the content expires and should be considered stale. This is used for caching control.
From contains the From header field value, which specifies the email address of the user making the request. This is rarely used in practice due to privacy concerns.
Host contains the Host header field value, which specifies the hostname and port of the target server. This is required in HTTP/1.1 requests.
IfModifiedSince contains the If-Modified-Since header field value, which allows conditional requests. The server will only return the resource if it has been modified since the specified date.
LastModified contains the Last-Modified header field value, which indicates when the resource was last modified. This is used for caching and conditional request processing.
Location contains the Location header field value, which specifies a URI for redirection or location of a newly created resource. This is commonly used in redirect responses.
Pragma contains the Pragma header field value, which provides implementation-specific directives. This is primarily used for backwards compatibility with HTTP/1.0 caches.
Referer contains the Referer header field value, which identifies the URI of the resource from which the request was made. This indicates the previous page that linked to the current request.

RetryAfter contains the Retry-After header field value, which indicates when the client should retry the request. This is used in responses with 503 (Service Unavailable) or 429 (Too Many Requests) status codes.
Server contains the Server header field value, which identifies the server software handling the request. This typically includes the server name and version information.
UserAgent contains the User-Agent header field value, which identifies the client application making the request. This typically includes browser name, version, and operating system information.
Warning contains the Warning header field value, which provides additional information about the status of a message. This is used to convey warnings that might not be reflected in the status code.

WWWAuthenticate contains the WWW-Authenticate header field value, which specifies the authentication schemes and parameters for the requested resource. This is sent in 401 (Unauthorized) responses to challenge the client for authentication.
Via contains the Via header field value, which tracks intermediate proxies and gateways. This header is used by proxies to indicate their presence in the request/response chain.
HTTPAccept is an alias for the Accept property. This provides alternative access to the Accept header field value.
HTTPAcceptCharset is an alias for the AcceptCharset property. This provides alternative access to the Accept-Charset header field value.
HTTPAcceptEncoding is an alias for the AcceptEncoding property. This provides alternative access to the Accept-Encoding header field value.
HTTPIfModifiedSince is an alias for the IfModifiedSince property. This provides alternative access to the If-Modified-Since header field value.
HTTPReferer is an alias for the Referer property. This provides alternative access to the Referer header field value.
HTTPUserAgent is an alias for the UserAgent property. This provides alternative access to the User-Agent header field value.
Cookie contains the Cookie header field value sent by the client. This includes all cookies that the client is sending to the server for this request.
SetCookie contains the Set-Cookie header field value to be sent to the client. This is used by servers to send cookies to the client for storage and future requests.
HTTPXRequestedWith contains the X-Requested-With header field value. This is commonly used by JavaScript frameworks to identify AJAX requests (typically set to 'XMLHttpRequest').
HttpVersion contains the HTTP protocol version used in the request or response. This indicates the HTTP version such as '1.0', '1.1', or '2.0'.
ProtocolVersion is an alias for HttpVersion. This provides alternative access to the HTTP protocol version information.
PathInfo contains the PATH_INFO environment variable value. This represents additional path information following the script name in the URL.
PathTranslated contains the PATH_TRANSLATED environment variable value. This represents the translated path information mapped to the file system.
RemoteAddress contains the IP address of the client making the request. This corresponds to the REMOTE_ADDR environment variable in CGI.
RemoteAddr is an alias for the RemoteAddress property. This provides alternative access to the client's IP address information.
RemoteHost contains the hostname of the client making the request. This corresponds to the REMOTE_HOST environment variable in CGI.
ScriptName contains the name of the script being executed. This corresponds to the SCRIPT_NAME environment variable in CGI.
ServerPort contains the port number on which the server received the request. This corresponds to the SERVER_PORT environment variable in CGI.
Method contains the HTTP request method used in the request. Common values include GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, and OPTIONS.
URL contains the complete URL of the current request. This includes the protocol, host, port, path, and query string components.
Query contains the query string portion of the request URL. This includes all parameters passed in the URL after the '?' character.
Content contains the request body content as a string. This is typically used for POST requests with text-based content types.
ContentBytes contains the request body content as raw bytes. This is useful for binary content or when the exact byte representation is needed.
CookieFields provides access to the parsed cookie values as name-value pairs. This collection contains all cookies sent by the client in the request.
ContentFields provides access to form field values from the request content. This collection contains parsed form data from POST requests.

element.name: THTTPHeader.QueryFields
element.short: Collection of query string name-value pairs

descr.p: QueryFields provides access to parsed query string parameters as name-value pairs. This collection contains all parameters passed in the URL query string.
CustomHeaders provides access to custom (non-standard) HTTP header fields. This collection contains application-specific headers beyond the standard HTTP headers.

element.name: TStreamingContentType
element.short: Content types for streaming HTTP data

descr.p: TStreamingContentType defines content types that can be used for streaming HTTP responses. This enumeration specifies different formats for server-sent events and streaming data.

element.name: TStreamingContentType.sctFormUrlEncoded
element.short: Form URL-encoded content type for streaming

element.name: TOnStreamEncodingEvent
element.short: Event type for stream encoding processing

descr.p: TOnStreamEncodingEvent is an event type called during stream content encoding processing. It provides access to the encoding state, buffer data, and size for custom processing of streamed content.

element.name: TOnStreamEncodingEvent.Sender
element.short: Object that triggered the stream encoding event

element.name: TOnUnknownEncodingEvent
element.short: Event type for handling unknown content encoding

descr.p: TOnUnknownEncodingEvent is an event type triggered when unknown content encoding is encountered. It allows custom handling of content with unrecognized encoding through the provided stream.

element.name: TOnUnknownEncodingEvent.Sender
element.short: Object that triggered the unknown encoding event

element.name: TOnUnknownEncodingEvent.ContentType
element.short: Content type that could not be recognized

element.name: TOnUnknownEncodingEvent.Stream
element.short: Stream containing the unknown encoded content

descr.p: TConnectionIDAllocator is a method type used for allocating connection identifiers. It takes a connection ID parameter and enables custom connection ID management.
IDAllocator is the connection ID allocator method instance used by the request. It provides the mechanism for generating and managing connection identifiers.
DefaultRequestUploadDir specifies the default directory where uploaded files are stored. This directory is used when no specific upload directory is configured for file uploads.
Create initializes a new TRequest object and allocates a unique request ID.
destroy cleans up resources used by the HTTP request instance. This includes releasing uploaded files, form data, and other associated objects.

element.name: TRequest.GetNextPathInfo
element.short: Gets the next path info segment

descr.p: GetNextPathInfo retrieves the next segment from the path info. This is useful for processing REST-style URLs with multiple path segments.

element.name: TRequest.GetNextPathInfo.Result
element.short: Next path info segment or empty string

element.name: TRequest.ToString
element.short: Returns string representation of the request

descr.p: ToString returns a formatted string containing key information about the HTTP request. This is useful for debugging and logging purposes.

element.name: TRequest.ToString.Result
element.short: String representation of the HTTP request

descr.p: RequestID contains a unique identifier assigned to this request. Useful for logging and tracking individual requests.
RouteParams provides access to route parameters extracted from the URL path. These are typically used in REST-style routing systems to capture URL segments as parameters.

element.name: TRequest.ReturnedPathInfo
element.short: Path info that was returned from GetNextPathInfo

descr.p: ReturnedPathInfo contains the path info segment that was most recently returned by GetNextPathInfo. This allows tracking of the current position when processing path segments.

element.name: TRequest.LocalPathPrefix
element.short: Local path prefix for the request

descr.p: LocalPathPrefix contains the local path prefix that should be prepended to relative paths. This is useful for handling requests in subdirectories or virtual directories.
CommandLine contains the complete HTTP command line from the request. This includes the method, URI, and HTTP version (e.g., 'GET /path HTTP/1.1').
Command contains the HTTP method and URI portion of the command line. This excludes the HTTP version information.
URI contains the URI portion of the HTTP request. This includes the path and query string but excludes the protocol and host information.

element.name: TRequest.QueryString
element.short: Query string portion of the request

descr.p: QueryString contains the query string portion of the request URL. This includes all parameters passed after the '?' character in the URL.
HeaderLine contains the complete first line of the HTTP request. This is the request line including method, URI, and HTTP version.
Files provides access to the collection of files uploaded with the request. This contains all files submitted through multipart form uploads.

element.name: TRequest.HandleGetOnPost
element.short: Whether to handle GET parameters on POST requests

descr.p: HandleGetOnPost determines whether GET parameters in the query string should be processed on POST requests. When True, both POST form data and GET query parameters are available.

element.name: TRequest.OnUnknownEncoding
element.short: Event handler for unknown content encoding

descr.p: OnUnknownEncoding is an event that fires when an unknown content encoding is encountered. This allows custom handling of non-standard content encodings.

element.name: TRequest.OnStreamEncodingEvent
element.short: Event handler for stream encoding processing

descr.p: OnStreamEncodingEvent is an event that fires during stream encoding processing. This allows custom handling of streaming content encoding.
IfMatch contains the If-Match header field value for conditional requests. This specifies entity tags that must match for the request to proceed.
IfNoneMatch contains the If-None-Match header field value for conditional requests. This specifies entity tags that must not match for the request to proceed.
IfRange contains the If-Range header field value for conditional range requests. This allows range requests only if the entity matches the specified condition.

IfUnModifiedSince contains the If-Unmodified-Since header field value for conditional requests. This specifies that the request should only proceed if the resource has not been modified since the given date.
ContentRange contains the Content-Range header field value. This indicates which part of a resource is being sent in partial content responses.
TE contains the TE header field value, which specifies the transfer encodings the client is willing to accept. This is used in HTTP/1.1 for specifying acceptable transfer encodings.
Upgrade contains the Upgrade header field value, which is used to upgrade the connection to a different protocol. Commonly used for WebSocket upgrades.

element.name: TRequest.KeepFullContents
element.short: Whether to keep full request contents in memory

descr.p: KeepFullContents determines whether the complete request content should be kept in memory. When True, the entire request body is stored; when False, memory usage is minimized.

THTTPServerEvent represents a server-sent event for real-time communication with web clients. This structure contains all the fields needed to send events to clients using the Server-Sent Events (SSE) standard.

element.name: THTTPServerEvent.ToString
element.short: Returns string representation of the server event

descr.p: ToString returns the server event formatted according to the Server-Sent Events specification. This includes all relevant fields formatted for transmission to the client.

element.name: THTTPServerEvent.ToString.Result
element.short: String representation of the server-sent event

descr.p: TResponse represents an HTTP response sent back to a client. It extends THTTPHeader and provides methods to set status codes, headers, content, cookies, and send the response data.
Create initializes a new HTTP response instance associated with the specified request. This sets up the response structure and links it to the corresponding request.

element.name: TResponse.Create.ARequest
element.short: HTTP request associated with this response

descr.p: destroy cleans up resources used by the HTTP response instance. This includes freeing any associated content streams and releasing memory.

element.name: TResponse.SendContent
element.short: Sends the response content to the client

descr.p: SendContent transmits the response body content to the client. This method sends the actual data payload of the HTTP response.

element.name: TResponse.SendHeaders
element.short: Sends the response headers to the client

descr.p: SendHeaders transmits the HTTP headers to the client. This must be called before sending any content and includes the status line and all response headers.
SendResponse sends both headers and content to the client, completing the HTTP response.
StartServerEvents initiates server-sent events (SSE) mode for real-time communication. This sets the appropriate headers and keeps the connection open for streaming events.
SendServerEvent transmits a single server-sent event to the client. This method formats and sends the event according to the SSE specification.
EndServerEvents terminates server-sent events mode and closes the SSE connection. This properly ends the event stream and releases associated resources.
SendRedirect sends an HTTP redirect response to the client. This sets the appropriate status code and Location header to redirect the client to a new URL.

element.name: TResponse.ToString
element.short: Returns string representation of the response

descr.p: ToString returns a formatted string containing key information about the HTTP response. This is useful for debugging and logging purposes.

element.name: TResponse.ToString.Result
element.short: String representation of the HTTP response

element.name: TResponse.SetStatus
element.short: Sets the HTTP status code and text

descr.p: SetStatus sets the HTTP status code and optionally sends it immediately. This method allows setting both the numeric status code and corresponding reason phrase.

element.name: TResponse.SetStatus.aSend
element.short: Whether to send the status immediately

descr.p: Request contains a reference to the HTTP request object that this response is answering. This provides access to the original request data for response generation.
Code contains the HTTP status code for the response. Common values include 200 (OK), 404 (Not Found), and 500 (Internal Server Error).
CodeText contains the reason phrase corresponding to the HTTP status code. This provides the descriptive text that accompanies the numeric status code.

element.name: TResponse.Age
element.short: Age header value indicating response age in seconds

descr.p: Age contains the Age header value, indicating how long the response has been cached. This value is measured in seconds since the response was generated.

element.name: TResponse.Allow
element.short: Allow header value listing permitted HTTP methods

descr.p: Allow contains the Allow header value, which lists the HTTP methods supported by the resource. This is commonly used in response to OPTIONS requests or with 405 Method Not Allowed responses.

element.name: TResponse.CacheControl
element.short: Cache-Control header value for caching directives

descr.p: CacheControl contains the Cache-Control header value with caching directives. This controls how the response should be cached by browsers and intermediate caches.

element.name: TResponse.ContentLocation
element.short: Content-Location header value for alternate location

descr.p: ContentLocation contains the Content-Location header value. This indicates an alternate location for the content that is being returned.

element.name: TResponse.ContentMD5
element.short: Content-MD5 header value with MD5 digest of content

descr.p: ContentMD5 contains the Content-MD5 header value with an MD5 digest of the response content. This provides integrity checking for the transmitted content.

element.name: TResponse.ContentRange
element.short: Content-Range header value for partial content

descr.p: ContentRange contains the Content-Range header value for partial content responses. This is used in 206 Partial Content responses to indicate which portion of the resource is being sent.

element.name: TResponse.ETag
element.short: ETag header value for entity tag validation

descr.p: ETag contains the ETag header value, which is an entity tag for cache validation. This provides a mechanism for efficient cache validation and conditional requests.

element.name: TResponse.ProxyAuthenticate
element.short: Proxy-Authenticate header value for proxy authentication

descr.p: ProxyAuthenticate contains the Proxy-Authenticate header value. This is sent in 407 Proxy Authentication Required responses to challenge the client for proxy authentication.

element.name: TResponse.RetryAfter
element.short: Retry-After header value indicating when to retry request

descr.p: RetryAfter contains the Retry-After header value, indicating when the client should retry the request. This is used with 503 Service Unavailable and 429 Too Many Requests responses.

element.name: TResponse.FirstHeaderLine
element.short: First line of HTTP response headers

descr.p: FirstHeaderLine contains the status line of the HTTP response. This includes the HTTP version, status code, and reason phrase.
ContentStream contains the response body content as a stream. This allows efficient handling of large responses without loading everything into memory.
Content contains the response body content as a string. This provides convenient access to the response content for text-based responses.

element.name: TResponse.Contents
element.short: String list containing response content lines

descr.p: Contents contains the response body content as a string list. This provides line-based access to the response content, with each line as a separate string.

element.name: TResponse.HeadersSent
element.short: Indicates whether response headers have been sent

descr.p: HeadersSent indicates whether the HTTP response headers have already been transmitted to the client. Once True, headers can no longer be modified.

element.name: TResponse.ContentSent
element.short: Indicates whether response content has been sent

descr.p: ContentSent indicates whether the response body content has been transmitted to the client. This helps track the completion status of the response.

element.name: TResponse.Cookies
element.short: Collection of HTTP cookies to send with response

descr.p: Cookies provides access to the collection of cookies that will be sent to the client. These cookies are included in Set-Cookie headers in the HTTP response.

element.name: TResponse.FreeContentStream
element.short: Whether to automatically free the content stream

descr.p: FreeContentStream determines whether the content stream should be automatically freed after use. When True, the stream is destroyed when the response is completed.
TSessionState defines the possible states of an HTTP session. This enumeration tracks the lifecycle of user sessions from creation to expiration.
TSessionStates represents a set of TSessionState values. It is used to track multiple session states simultaneously during session management.

element.name: TCustomSession
element.short: Base class for HTTP session management

descr.p: TCustomSession provides the foundation for HTTP session management functionality. It handles session initialization, variable management, state tracking, and cleanup operations.
Create constructs a new session instance with the specified owner. It initializes the session with default values and prepares it for use.

element.name: TCustomSession.InitSession
element.short: Initializes the session from HTTP request

descr.p: InitSession initializes the session using data from the HTTP request. It reads session cookies and triggers the new session event handler if needed.

element.name: TCustomSession.InitSession.ARequest
element.short: HTTP request to initialize session from

element.name: TCustomSession.InitSession.OnNewSession
element.short: Event handler called when new session is created

element.name: TCustomSession.InitSession.OnExpired
element.short: Event handler called when session expires

element.name: TCustomSession.InitResponse
element.short: Initializes the HTTP response for the session

descr.p: InitResponse initializes the HTTP response for session handling. It sets up response headers and cookies required for session management.

element.name: TCustomSession.InitResponse.AResponse
element.short: HTTP response to initialize for session

element.name: TCustomSession.UpdateResponse
element.short: Updates the HTTP response with session information

descr.p: UpdateResponse updates the HTTP response with current session information. It ensures session cookies and headers are properly set in the response.

element.name: TCustomSession.UpdateResponse.AResponse
element.short: HTTP response to update with session data

element.name: TCustomSession.RemoveVariable
element.short: Removes a variable from the session

descr.p: RemoveVariable removes the specified variable from the session storage. The variable name is case-insensitive for removal operations.

element.name: TCustomSession.RemoveVariable.VariableName
element.short: Name of the variable to remove

descr.p: Terminate terminates the current session and cleans up session data. It marks the session for deletion and removes associated cookies from the response.

element.name: TCustomSession.SessionVariableExists
element.short: Checks if a session variable exists

descr.p: SessionVariableExists checks whether a variable with the specified name exists in the session. Returns True if the variable exists, False otherwise.

element.name: TCustomSession.SessionVariableExists.Result
element.short: True if the variable exists, False otherwise

element.name: TCustomSession.SessionVariableExists.VarName
element.short: Name of the variable to check for existence

descr.p: TimeOutMinutes specifies the session timeout period in minutes. Sessions that remain inactive longer than this period will expire automatically.
SessionID contains the unique identifier for the current session. This identifier is used to track and maintain session state across HTTP requests.

element.name: TCustomSession.SessionCookie
element.short: Name of the cookie used to store session ID

descr.p: SessionCookie specifies the name of the HTTP cookie used to store the session ID. This cookie name is used for both reading and writing session information.

element.name: TCustomSession.SessionCookiePath
element.short: Path attribute for the session cookie

descr.p: SessionCookiePath defines the path scope for the session cookie. The cookie will only be sent for requests matching this path prefix.

element.name: TCustomSession.Variables
element.short: Access to session variables by name

descr.p: Variables provides access to the session variables collection. It allows storing and retrieving named values that persist across HTTP requests within the session.

element.name: TCustomSession.Variables.VarName
element.short: Name of the session variable to access

descr.p: SessionState indicates the current state of the session. It tracks whether the session is new, active, or has been terminated.

element.name: TCustomSession.OnSessionStateChange
element.short: Event triggered when session state changes

descr.p: OnSessionStateChange is triggered when the session state changes. It allows monitoring and responding to session state transitions.

element.name: TRequestEvent
element.short: Event procedure type for HTTP request handling

descr.p: TRequestEvent is an event type for handling HTTP request processing. It provides access to the request object during various stages of request handling.

element.name: TRequestEvent.Sender
element.short: Object that triggered the request event

element.name: TResponseEvent
element.short: Event procedure type for HTTP response handling

descr.p: TResponseEvent is an event type for handling HTTP response processing. It provides access to the response object during various stages of response generation.

element.name: TResponseEvent.Sender
element.short: Object that triggered the response event

descr.p: EHTTP is an exception class for HTTP-related errors. It includes properties for HTTP status code and status text.

element.name: EHTTP.StatusCode
element.short: HTTP status code of the error

descr.p: StatusCode contains the HTTP status code associated with the error. This numeric code indicates the type of HTTP error that occurred.

element.name: EHTTP.StatusText
element.short: HTTP status text of the error

descr.p: StatusText contains the textual description of the HTTP status code. This provides a human-readable explanation of the error condition.
HTTPError creates an EHTTP exception with the specified status code and message. It provides a convenient way to raise HTTP-specific errors with proper status information.

element.name: TCORSOption
element.short: Options for CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) configuration

descr.p: TCORSOption defines individual options for CORS configuration. These options control various aspects of cross-origin resource sharing behavior.

element.name: TCORSOption.coEmptyDomainToOrigin
element.short: Convert empty domain to origin in CORS

descr.p: TCORSOptions is a set of TCORSOption values. It allows combining multiple CORS configuration options for comprehensive control.
THandleCORSOption defines options that control how CORS requests are handled. These options affect the processing and response generation for cross-origin requests.
THandleCORSOptions is a set of THandleCORSOption values. It allows configuring multiple aspects of CORS request handling behavior.
TCORSSupport provides functionality for handling CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) requests. It manages allowed origins, methods, headers, and other CORS-related settings.

element.name: TCORSSupport.Create
element.short: Creates a new CORS support instance

descr.p: Create constructs a new CORS support instance with the specified owner. It initializes the CORS configuration with default values.

element.name: TCORSSupport.ResolvedCORSAllowedOrigins
element.short: Resolves allowed origins for CORS requests

descr.p: ResolvedCORSAllowedOrigins resolves the list of allowed origins for the current request. It processes the configured origins and returns the applicable ones based on the request context.

element.name: TCORSSupport.ResolvedCORSAllowedOrigins.aRequest
element.short: HTTP request to resolve origins for

descr.p: HandleRequest processes CORS headers and validation for the HTTP request. It returns the appropriate CORS handling result based on the request and configuration.

element.name: TCORSSupport.HandleRequest.Result
element.short: True if CORS request was handled, False otherwise

element.name: TCORSSupport.HandleRequest.aRequest
element.short: HTTP request to handle for CORS

element.name: TCORSSupport.HandleRequest.aResponse
element.short: HTTP response to populate with CORS headers

element.name: TCORSSupport.Assign
element.short: Assigns CORS settings from another object

descr.p: Assign copies CORS configuration settings from another TCORSSupport instance. It transfers all CORS options, origins, methods, and headers to the current instance.

element.name: TCORSSupport.Assign.Source
element.short: Source object to copy CORS settings from

descr.p: Enabled controls whether CORS processing is active. When True, CORS headers are processed and validated for cross-origin requests.
Options contains the set of CORS configuration options. These options control various aspects of CORS behavior such as credential handling.

element.name: TCORSSupport.AllowedMethods
element.short: HTTP methods allowed for CORS requests

descr.p: AllowedMethods specifies the HTTP methods permitted for cross-origin requests. Common methods include GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, and OPTIONS.
AllowedOrigins contains the list of origins permitted to make cross-origin requests. Origins can be specific domains or wildcard patterns for broader access.
AllowedHeaders specifies the HTTP headers that are permitted in cross-origin requests. This controls which headers clients can include in their CORS requests.

element.name: TCORSSupport.MaxAge
element.short: Maximum age for CORS preflight cache in seconds

descr.p: MaxAge specifies how long browsers may cache CORS preflight responses. This value is sent in the Access-Control-Max-Age header to control preflight caching.
HTTPDecode converts a URL-encoded string back to its original form, replacing percent-encoded characters with their actual values.
HTTPEncode converts a string to URL-encoded format, replacing special characters with percent-encoded representations suitable for HTTP transmission.

element.name: IncludeHTTPPathDelimiter
element.short: Ensures path ends with forward slash

descr.p: IncludeHTTPPathDelimiter appends a forward slash ('/') to the end of a path string if it doesn't already end with one, ensuring proper HTTP path formatting.

element.name: IncludeHTTPPathDelimiter.Result
element.short: Path string with trailing slash delimiter

element.name: IncludeHTTPPathDelimiter.AStr
element.short: HTTP path string to add delimiter to

element.name: UploadedFilesClass
element.short: Global variable for uploaded files class type

descr.p: UploadedFilesClass is a global class reference variable for TUploadedFiles. It allows customization of the uploaded files collection class used throughout the HTTP framework.

element.name: UploadedFileClass
element.short: Global variable for uploaded file class type

descr.p: UploadedFileClass is a global class reference variable for TUploadedFile. It allows customization of the uploaded file class used for individual file uploads.

element.name: MimeItemsClass
element.short: Global variable for MIME items class type

descr.p: MimeItemsClass is a global class reference variable for TMimeItems. It allows customization of the MIME items collection class used for content processing.

element.name: MimeItemClass
element.short: Global variable for MIME item class type

descr.p: MimeItemClass is a global class reference variable for TMimeItem. It allows customization of the MIME item class used for individual content items.

element.name: DefaultAllowedHeaders
element.short: Default set of allowed CORS headers

descr.p: DefaultAllowedHeaders contains the default set of HTTP headers allowed in CORS requests. This constant provides a standard list of commonly permitted headers for cross-origin requests.

element.name: DefaultAllowedOrigins
element.short: Default set of allowed CORS origins

descr.p: DefaultAllowedOrigins contains the default set of origins allowed for CORS requests. This constant provides a standard list of permitted origins for cross-origin resource sharing.

element.name: DefaultAllowedMethods
element.short: Default set of allowed CORS methods

descr.p: DefaultAllowedMethods contains the default set of HTTP methods allowed in CORS requests. This constant provides a standard list of permitted methods for cross-origin resource sharing.
